clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Aging, Autonomic Nervous System Activity and Cardiovascular Events
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Aging, Autonomic Nervous System Activity and Cardiovascular Events on a Prospective Cohort of Subjects Aged 65 Years

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

brief_summary.textblock:
The regulatory effects of the autonomic nervous system (ANS) concern almost all organs which permanently feed information back to this global biological vigilance system controlling allostasis. Heart rate fluctuations are highly dependent on ANS control, making the heart one of the best indicators of ANS activity.
Low ANS activity level is associated with severe cardiac and cerebral events, as well as to death from any cause in the general population.
This PROOF study was hence designed to evaluate ANS activity levels among a healthy retired population, but should these levels decline overtime, to use this as a predictor of cardiovascular and cerebrovascular events, taking into account established cardiovascular risk factors.

detailed_description.textblock: The main goal of this PROOF study is to evaluate, on a selected prospective cohort of subjects aged 65 years upon study entry, the prognostic values of ANS activity levels measured at preset times, and more specifically, of its decline over the follow-up period, for fatal and non-fatal cardiovascular and cerebrovascular events.

primary_outcome.measure: Composite criterion : fatal and non-fatal cardiovascular or cerebrovascular events

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence and severity of clinically silent stroke revealed through brain MRI
ANS activity measured by heart rate variability + spontaneous baroreflex + blood pressure variability
Biological data : fasting blood glucose, total and HDL cholesterol, triglycerides and CRP

arm_group.description: Healthy inhabitants of the city of Saint-Etienne, France, and aged 65 years at the inclusion date.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects were recruited amongst the inhabitants of the city of Saint-Etienne, France, and were eligible if aged 65 at the inclusion date.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 65 years old
- informed consent signed
Exclusion Criteria:
- prior myocardiac infarction
- prior stroke
- hearth failure
- atrial fibrillation
- insulin-treated diabetes mellitus
- cardiac pacemaker
- disease limiting life expectancy to < 5 years
- contraindication to brain MRI
- living in an institution
